info.title: PolicyClient
info.description: To manage and control access to your resources, you can define customized policies and assign them at a scope.

delete.summary: Deletes a policy assignment by ID.
delete.description: When providing a scope for the assigment, use '/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/' for subscriptions, '/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}' for resource groups, and '/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}/providers/{resource-provider-namespace}/{resource-type}/{resource-name}' for resources.

parameters.name: policyAssignmentId
parameters.description: The ID of the policy assignment to delete. Use the format '/{scope}/providers/Microsoft.Authorization/policyAssignments/{policy-assignment-name}'.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the policy assignment.

displayName.description: The display name of the policy assignment.

policyDefinitionId.description: The ID of the policy definition.

scope.description: The scope for the policy assignment.

parameters.description: Required if a parameter is used in policy rule.

description.description: This message will be part of response in case of policy violation.

id.description: The ID of the policy assignment.

type.description: The type of the policy assignment.

name.description: The name of the policy assignment.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: The ID of the target subscription.

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for the operation.
